Package com.github.mlposey

Class Translator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mlposey.Translator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GoogleTranslator, YandexTranslator

    public abstract class Translator
extends java.lang.Object
    An asynchronous abstraction for web-based translation services. A Translator can perform the following operations asynchronously:
    - translate text from one language to another
    - identify the language of a text
    - determine if the service supports a translation direction (e.g., en-ru)

    You should have the appropriate API key set as an environment variable before using any variation of this class. Key provides information on naming conventions for Yandex and Google keys.

    Disregarding service restrictions, you can submit any number of requests without waiting on previous results. Just ensure shutdown(long) is called when the Translator will no longer accept requests. Queries cannot be submitted after shutting the translator down.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Translator

        public Translator​(Key apiKey,
                  java.lang.String host)
        Constructs a Translator object.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - the API key for a translation service
        host - the host URL for the service (e.g., https://translation.googleapis.com/language/translate/v2)

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown​(long timeout)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops all ongoing translations and shuts down the thread pool.

        Once shut down, a Translator cannot be restarted. Further translations require creation of a new Translator object.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the time in seconds to wait before shutting down
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if all translations were not completed

      • translate

        public final void translate​(Text from,
                            Language to,
                            java.util.function.Consumer<Text[]> consumer)
        Translates text to another language.

        This ignores possible errors generated by the translation service. To handle them, use translate(Text, Language, Consumer, Consumer) instead. If an error is generated, translate will not invoke consumer.

        Parameters:
        from - the untranslated text
        to - the language into which 'from' should be translated
        consumer - consumes the resulting translation. Some services will return many possible translations for a given text, so the consumer should handle an array of Text objects.

      • translate

        public final void translate​(Text from,
                            Language to,
                            java.util.function.Consumer<Text[]> consumer,
                            java.util.function.Consumer<TranslationError> errorHandler)
        Translates text to another language.
        Parameters:
        from - the untranslated text
        to - the language into which 'from' should be translated
        consumer - consumes the resulting translation. Some services will return many possible translations for a given text, so the consumer should handle an array of Text objects.
        errorHandler - called if translation fails. The error contains a TranslationError.getCode() method that returns the services error code. consumer is not invoked if errorHandler is called.

      • translateImpl

        protected abstract Text[] translateImpl​(Text from,
                                        Language to)
                                 throws TranslationError
        Throws:
        TranslationError

      • identify

        public final void identify​(java.lang.String mysteryText,
                           java.util.function.Consumer<Language[]> consumer)
        Identifies the language of a string of text.

        This ignores possible errors generated by the translation service. To handle them, use identify(String, Consumer, Consumer) instead. If an error is generated, identify will not invoke consumer.

        Parameters:
        mysteryText - a text of unknown language origins
        consumer - consumes the resulting language possibilities. Since some text can span multiple languages (e.g., 'no'), the consumer should process Language[].

      • identify

        public final void identify​(java.lang.String mysteryText,
                           java.util.function.Consumer<Language[]> consumer,
                           java.util.function.Consumer<TranslationError> errorHandler)
        Identifies the language of a string of text.
        Parameters:
        mysteryText - a text of unknown language origins
        consumer - consumes the resulting language possibilities. Since some text can span multiple languages (e.g., 'no'), the consumer should process Language[].
        errorHandler - called if identification fails. The error contains a TranslationError.getCode() method that returns the services error code. consumer is not invoked if errorHandler is called.

      • identifyImpl

        protected abstract Language[] identifyImpl​(java.lang.String mysteryText)
                                    throws TranslationError
        Throws:
        TranslationError

      • hasSupport

        public final void hasSupport​(Language from,
                             Language to,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> consumer)
        Determines the service's support for a translation direction.

        This ignores possible errors generated by the translation service. To handle them, use hasSupport(Language, Language, Consumer, Consumer) instead. If an error is generated, hasSupport will not invoke consumer.

        Parameters:
        from - the language of a potential source text
        to - the language of a potential target text
        consumer - consumes a boolean which is true if a translation direction is supported or false if it is not.

      • hasSupport

        public final void hasSupport​(Language from,
                             Language to,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> consumer,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<TranslationError> errorHandler)
        Determines the service's support for a translation direction.
        Parameters:
        from - the language of a potential source text
        to - the language of a potential target text
        consumer - consumes a boolean which is true if a translation direction is supported or false if it is not.
        errorHandler - called if the query fails. The error contains a TranslationError.getCode() method that returns the services error code. consumer is not invoked if errorHandler is called.

      • hasSupportImpl

        protected abstract boolean hasSupportImpl​(Language from,
                                          Language to)
                                   throws TranslationError
        Throws:
        TranslationError
